articles.headline: Giving proper credit
articles.author_title: Research Analyst, The San Diego Union-Tribune
articles.summary: This article explores the issue of proper crediting in computer-assisted reporting (CAR), describing scenarios where CAR contributions go uncredited and suggesting methods for ensuring recognition.

articles.headline: Sept. 11 loans steered to the unscathed
articles.summary: The article investigates the distribution of post-9/11 disaster loans, revealing that many funds were allocated away from directly impacted areas, raising questions about financial oversight.

articles.headline: Analysis finds bias in jury picks
articles.author_title: CAR Editor, The Dallas Morning News
articles.summary: A statistical analysis of jury selection in Dallas County reveals continued racial bias in juror exclusions, highlighting slow progress since a 1986 exposé.

articles.headline: Meth stories win first Meyer Award
articles.summary: A series of investigations into the methamphetamine crisis and other issues received the first Philip Meyer Awards, highlighting significant contributions of social science methods in journalism.

articles.headline: Farm story gets CAR started
articles.summary: After attending a CAR Boot Camp, the author utilizes CAR techniques to analyze farm accident data, showcasing the potential of data journalism in local reporting.
